intro: Melochia yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas melochia, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
